travels.title: Sweden '05
travels.headertext: We visited Sweden, along with Mom, in August of 2005. Jim was living in Skutskar at the time, so we were based there. We did side trips into Stockholm and took the ferry over to Helsinki for a day.

entry.text: Jim took us out to see Falu Koppargruva in Dalarna. It's a big copper mine that funded most of the Swedish expansion in the 17th century. The first reference to it is in a stock purchase record from 1288. The big hole is mainly because of a huge collapse in the 17th century. There are tours through the old mine tunnels and a museum.

In Stockholm, we visited the Vasa Musuem. The Vasa was the flagship of the Swedish fleet. Unfortunately, within minutes of being launched in 1628, it sunk. Its been raised and installed into a museum.
Here's a view of the ferry we took to Finland, docked in Helsinki.
